title: Bug 49195 Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases. There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that. I suppose that jsvc may show the same behavior, but I have not tried.
OB: When using Tomcat as a service on Windows and specifying the shutdown port as 1 in the server.xml configuration file, the service is successfully stopped but displays an error message in the console.
EB: If the shutdown port is set to 1 in the server.xml configuration file, the service should be stopped without displaying any error messages.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. 
2. Start the service. 
3. Stop the service. 
4. Shut down the server through an OS signal, such as by calling Catalina.stop().
